vocabinfos.relatedNos: [{'strongNumber': 'H1867G', 'matchingForm': 'דָּֽרְיָ֫וֶשׁ', 'stepTransliteration': 'da.re.ya.vesh', 'gloss': 'Darius', '_searchResultRange': 'Neh.12.22', '_zh_tw_Gloss': '大利烏', '_es_Gloss': 'Darío', '_zh_Gloss': '大利乌'}, {'strongNumber': 'H1867H', 'matchingForm': 'דָּֽרְיָ֫וֶשׁ', 'stepTransliteration': 'da.re.ya.vesh', 'gloss': 'Darius', '_searchResultRange': 'Ezra.4.5-Zech.7.1', '_zh_tw_Gloss': '大利烏', '_es_Gloss': 'Darío', '_zh_Gloss': '大利乌'}, {'strongNumber': 'H1867I', 'matchingForm': 'דָּֽרְיָ֫וֶשׁ', 'stepTransliteration': 'da.re.ya.vesh', 'gloss': 'Darius', '_searchResultRange': 'Dan.9.1-11.1@Dan.5.31-11.1', '_zh_tw_Gloss': '大利烏', '_es_Gloss': 'Darío', '_zh_Gloss': '大利乌'}, {'strongNumber': 'H1868H', 'matchingForm': 'דָּֽרְיָ֫וֶשׁ', 'stepTransliteration': 'da.re.ya.vesh', 'gloss': 'Darius', '_searchResultRange': 'Dan.5.31-6.28@Dan.5.31-11.1', '_zh_tw_Gloss': '大利烏', '_es_Gloss': 'Darío', '_zh_Gloss': '大利乌'}]
vocabinfos.mediumDef:
A man living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezr.4.5
Aramaic of dar.ya.vesh (דָּֽרְיָ֫וֶשׁ "Darius" H1867H)
§ Darius = "lord"
1) Darius the Mede, the son of Ahasuerus, king of the Chaldeans, who succeeded to the Babylonian kingdom on the death of Belshazzar; probably the same as "Astyages" the last king of the Medes (538 BC) (same as dar.ya.vesh (דָּֽרְיָ֫וֶשׁ "Darius" H1867) (1))
2) Darius, the son of Hystaspes, the founder of the Perso-Arian dynasty (521 BC) (same as (2))
3) Darius II or Darius III
3a) Darius II, Nothus (Ochus) was king of Persia during the time of Nehemiah (424/3-405/4 BC). Darius II is the most probable because he is mentioned by Nehemiah and ruled during the time of Nehemiah
3b) Darius III, Codomannus was king of Persia during its last years at the time of Alexander the Great and was his opponent (336-330 BC)
vocabinfos._zh_tw_Definition:
大利烏 这个陽性專有名詞 人名在原文的意思是 "主"
1) 瑪代人大利烏, 亞哈隨魯的兒子, 迦勒底國的王,
他在巴比倫王伯沙撒去世後繼承了巴比倫王國;可能與
瑪代的最後一個王阿士他奇伯(Astyages)是同一人 ( 相同於 1867 (1) ) ( #但 5:31)
2) 大利烏 Hystaspes 的兒子, 波-亞(Perso-Arian) 王朝的建立者 (西元前521) (與 1867 (2) 同)
vocabinfos._zh_Definition:
大利乌 这个阳性专有名词 人名在原文的意思是 "主"
1) 玛代人大利乌, 亚哈随鲁的儿子, 迦勒底国的王,
他在巴比伦王伯沙撒去世后继承了巴比伦王国;可能与
玛代的最后一个王阿士他奇伯(Astyages)是同一人 ( 相同于 1867 (1) ) ( #但 5:31)
2) 大利乌 Hystaspes 的儿子, 波-亚(Perso-Arian) 王朝的建立者 (西元前521) (与 1867 (2) 同)

vocabinfos.mediumDef:
A man living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Dan.5.31;
son of: Ahasuerus (H0325)
Aramaic of dar.ya.vesh (דָּֽרְיָ֫וֶשׁ "Darius" H1867I)
§ Darius = "lord"
1) Darius the Mede, the son of Ahasuerus, king of the Chaldeans, who succeeded to the Babylonian kingdom on the death of Belshazzar; probably the same as "Astyages" the last king of the Medes (538 BC) (same as dar.ya.vesh (דָּֽרְיָ֫וֶשׁ "Darius" H1867) (1))
2) Darius, the son of Hystaspes, the founder of the Perso-Arian dynasty (521 BC) (same as (2))
3) Darius II or Darius III
3a) Darius II, Nothus (Ochus) was king of Persia during the time of Nehemiah (424/3-405/4 BC). Darius II is the most probable because he is mentioned by Nehemiah and ruled during the time of Nehemiah
3b) Darius III, Codomannus was king of Persia during its last years at the time of Alexander the Great and was his opponent (336-330 BC)
